title-group.article-title: The Characteristics of High Temperature Thermistor with New Materials

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1990 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: NTC temperature sensing thermistors have been based upon metal oxide materials such as Mn-Ni oxide. These thermistors are limited in practical application to 250 ° C. It was desired to extend the useful thermistor range to 500 ° C. Therefore, the authors investigated various types of non-oxide materials. Non-oxide materials were selected because, despite difficulties in processing, the high temperature performance of such materials was believed to be stable. It was found that A1203-B4C and A1203-B4C-SiC were acceptable materials for high temperature NTC applications. Using these basic materials, and exercising special process controls, high temperature glass-sealed NTC thermistors were fabricated. After extended environmental and life tests, it was found that the resulting sensors provided repeatable temperature measurements over a long period of time and were suitable for their intended applications.
